Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 6 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> [@cicatrix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120831-cicatrix/) Damn, I wasn't aware there was a problem. I need a well repeatable scenario on how to repeat the problem
> 

Does my rover from my initial post get loaded normally at your machine? Because it doesn't at mine.

Each pair of tanks it has has different fuel setup (LqdAmmonia, Hydrazine, Hydrogen, Nitrogen, Water).

When it loads all tanks are loaded with hydrogen for some reason, except one. And whereas the .craft is saved with empty tanks, it is loaded with full.

> 
> 
> 6 minutes ago, cicatrix said:
> 
> 
> Does my rover from my initial post get loaded normally at your machine? Because it doesn't at mine.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Each pair of tanks it has has different fuel setup (LqdAmmonia, Hydrazine, Hydrogen, Nitrogen, Water).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> When it loads all tanks are loaded with hydrogen for some reason, except one. And whereas the .craft is saved with empty tanks, it is loaded with full.
> 

I loaded it, but I'm not sure what it is supposed to be, I see 1 big Hydrazine, 8 medium hydrogen, 2 amonia. most hydrogentanks are empty

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-09T07:09:47Z" title="11/09/2016 07:09  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 9, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> I loaded it, but I'm not sure what it is supposed to be, I see 1 big Hydrazine, 8 medium hydrogen, 2 amonia. most hydrogentanks are empty
> 

If you load the craft into notepad you'll see it should also have water tanks and nitrogen tanks:

    MODULE{	name = InterstellarFuelSwitch	isEnabled = True	selectedTankSetup = 14	inFlightTankSetup = -1	configuredAmounts = 0,	configuredFlowStates = True,	selectedTankSetupTxt = Water	configLoaded = True	initialTankSetup = LqdHydrogen	storedVolumeMultiplier = 1	storedMassMultiplier = 1	traceBoiloff = False	stagingEnabled = True	EVENTS	{	}	ACTIONS	{	}	UPGRADESAPPLIED	{	}}
    
    ...
    
    MODULE{	name = InterstellarFuelSwitch	isEnabled = True	selectedTankSetup = 12	inFlightTankSetup = -1	configuredAmounts = 0,	configuredFlowStates = True,	selectedTankSetupTxt = Liquid Nitrogen	configLoaded = True	initialTankSetup = LqdHydrogen	storedVolumeMultiplier = 1	storedMassMultiplier = 1	traceBoiloff = False	stagingEnabled = True	EVENTS	{	}	ACTIONS	{	}	UPGRADESAPPLIED	{	}}

I attached the log file from the process before.

I can give you my save when I return home, but I'm afraid I'm using too many mods. 

The problem is that after upgrade existing crafts that have interstellar fuel tanks changed fuel type. I even tried to manually edit them in the save game but when any of those ships are loaded into the flight scene, the tanks get re-fuelled with LqdHydrogen again (even though their initial setup was for differen fuel - hydrazine mostly).

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-09T08:36:36Z" title="11/09/2016 08:36  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 9, 2016</time> by cicatrix**

[@cicatrix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120831-cicatrix/) Well this was totally not my intention. The goal was to make it more reliable ,, not less

For the moment I change my adviced version to the previous version

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, cicatrix said:
> 
> 
> If you load the craft into notepad you'll see it should also have water tanks and nitrogen tanks:
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     MODULE{	name = InterstellarFuelSwitch	isEnabled = True	selectedTankSetup = 14	inFlightTankSetup = -1	configuredAmounts = 0,	configuredFlowStates = True,	selectedTankSetupTxt = Water	configLoaded = True	initialTankSetup = LqdHydrogen	storedVolumeMultiplier = 1	storedMassMultiplier = 1	traceBoiloff = False	stagingEnabled = True	EVENTS	{	}	ACTIONS	{	}	UPGRADESAPPLIED	{	}}
>     
>     ...
>     
>     MODULE{	name = InterstellarFuelSwitch	isEnabled = True	selectedTankSetup = 12	inFlightTankSetup = -1	configuredAmounts = 0,	configuredFlowStates = True,	selectedTankSetupTxt = Liquid Nitrogen	configLoaded = True	initialTankSetup = LqdHydrogen	storedVolumeMultiplier = 1	storedMassMultiplier = 1	traceBoiloff = False	stagingEnabled = True	EVENTS	{	}	ACTIONS	{	}	UPGRADESAPPLIED	{	}}
> 

Hey, where are the resources declarations?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-09T08:40:47Z" title="11/09/2016 08:40  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 9, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

> 
> 
> 9 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> [@cicatrix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120831-cicatrix/) Well this was totally not my intention. The goal was to make it more reliable ,, not less
> 
> 
> 
> 
> For the moment I change my adviced version to the previous version
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Hey, where are the resources declarations?
> 

I did not include them, but they're there (you can see them in the .craft file):

    RESOURCE
        {
            name = Water
            amount = 0
            maxAmount = 8400
            flowState = True
            isTweakable = True
            hideFlow = False
            isVisible = True
            flowMode = Both
        }
    
    ...
    
    RESOURCE
        {
            name = LqdNitrogen
            amount = 0
            maxAmount = 8400
            flowState = True
            isTweakable = True
            hideFlow = False
            isVisible = True
            flowMode = Both
        }

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-09T08:49:34Z" title="11/09/2016 08:49  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 9, 2016</time> by cicatrix**

[@cicatrix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120831-cicatrix/) Well they are important, as this is what leading now for the selection for the tank (in the past is was  SelectedTankTxt . somehow this is not working right ...

[@cicatrix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120831-cicatrix/)  Alright, after analyzing the you log, I beginning to understand what is going wrong. somehow, the default resource is comming back from the grave which depending on is name create more or less havoc, I need to keep him back in the coffin.

This also explains why stock tanks with IFS don't have this problem so much, LiquidFuel is reasonbly high in the list, only Xenon tanks might get messed up..

> 
> 
> 18 hours ago, th3AddY said:
> 
> 
> Would be nice if anyone found a solution for that ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

Now that I understand what is going wrong, I also know a hack to foce it to use the correct tank, simply change the default resource to the last one in the IFS resource list, which is Water.  Effectly this means you need to change the resource LqdHydrogen into Water.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-09T10:00:39Z" title="11/09/2016 10:00  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 9, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

> 
> 
> 22 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Now that I understand what is going wrong, I also know a hack to foce it to use the correct tank, simply change the default resource to the last one in the IFS resource list, which is Water.  Effectly this means you need to change the resource LqdHydrogen in to water.
> 

Could you elaborate a bit more? Where should I change it? In my existing craft? In the save file or only in new ones?

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, cicatrix said:
> 
> 
> Could you elaborate a bit more? Where should I change it? In my existing craft? In the save file or only in new ones?
> 

You need to change it in the part defenition file or script which adds IFS. At least in IFS tanks, the  initial resource is LqdHydrogen,

Another solution would be to remove the resource all together, this should be a fool proof method

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-09T10:05:07Z" title="11/09/2016 10:05  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 9, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

[@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/) Yeah, it worked. I just had to change LqdHydrogen to Water in the InterstellarFuelTank-X200-32.cfg file of KSPI. Thank you so much! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I could have done it for all the other part definition files, but I think this fix is temporary and the mods will be updated soon.

[@cicatrix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120831-cicatrix/) Oh I forgot, there is an even easier method, add "adaptiveTankSelection = false" to definition

I will upload a version in which this is by default

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-09T19:48:02Z" title="11/09/2016 07:48  PM" data-short="7 yr">November 9, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

## 
Version 2.2.8 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.2.1</small>

<small>Released on 2016-11-09</small>

- Fix: disabled adaptiveTankSelection by default which was causing problems when an existing resource is present on the rank
- Fix: disabled verbose Log messaging
- Included Module Manager to 2.7.3

[@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/), on Spacedock you or maybe Spacedock apparently named the 2.2.8 IFS update as one for KSP Interstellar Extended, as that was what the update notice email I got said.  The download was only 755 KB, so I figured it was really IFS...also, on Spacedock there is no version 2.2.8 for IFS in the changelog, only goes up to 2.2.7.

[@Laguna](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/152463-laguna/) weird, I'm sure I had uploaded IFS 2.2.8, the version dump is proof of it as you can only generate this after an upload. Somehow it got lost...  

I uploaded it again

Edit: it is explained, I uploaded it to the wronf location

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-15T11:32:50Z" title="11/15/2016 11:32  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 15, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

Is there a way to prevent some models from showing in the editor list when making a part with Interstellar Mesh Switch? Right now all the models are showing in the little icon in the editor list and it looks kind of weird. Thanks,

Benji13.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Benji13 said:
> 
> 
> Is there a way to prevent some models from showing in the editor list when making a part with Interstellar Mesh Switch? Right now all the models are showing in the little icon in the editor list and it looks kind of weird. Thanks,
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Benji13.
> 

In unity you need to add the "Icon\_Hidden" tag to every mesh you want to hide.  
![oGqg1Eu.png](http://i.imgur.com/oGqg1Eu.png)

> 
> 
> 12 minutes ago, Eleusis La Arwall said:
> 
> 
> In unity you need to add the "Icon\_Hidden" tag to every mesh you want to hide.  
> [![oGqg1Eu.png](http://i.imgur.com/oGqg1Eu.png)](http://i.imgur.com/oGqg1Eu.png "Enlarge image")
> 

Thanks. Do you have to add tags in the IMS config as well or does it go along with the mesh?

> 
> 
> Just now, Benji13 said:
> 
> 
> Thanks. Do you have to add tags in the IMS config as well or does it go along with the mesh?
> 

No, just add the tag and you're done.

## 
Version 2.2.9 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.2.1</small>

<small>Released on 2016-11-20</small>

- Added ability to jettison all fuel in a container to all Fuel switches
- Increased resource amount IFS storage container
- Added PolyvinylChloride to IFS storage container
